Header: A leak in the Crude oil pipe line to Kolonnawa
Content: The Marine Environment Protection Authority stated that the leak in the crude oil pipeline that linked to the Kolonnawa Oil Terminal Refinery is under control. A cracked pipe which is part of the pipeline that runs along the Colombo Port sea line was reported last evening. The leak caused crude oil to seep out into the ocean. The Chairman of the authority of Marine Environment Protection, Retired Rear Admiral Rohana Perera told our news team rough seas could be the reason for the burst. He also said that approximately 25 metric tons of crude oil is believed to have leaked into the ocean He also said situation is under control, despite the difficulty experienced in during repairs as a result of rough seas.
